page.title: 01POLITICS
page.content: Ormskirk is the centre of the WestLancashire District Council which was formed in 1974 following the reorganisation of local governments and is one of the fourteen non-metropolitan districts of Lancashire. The District is divided into 26 wards and 55 Councillors are elected to serve for four years. The Council meet every six weeks to consider reccomendations. Conservatives have been in control since 1976 before which there was no overall controll. The Conservative member of Parliament for West Lancashire is Mr K. Hind esq. and the member of the European Parliament is Mr P.N. Price esq. The Council employ 660 peoplehaving been reduced considerably over the last few years.
